clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Follow-up Study of Substance Abuse Screening and Intervention in Multi Primary Care Centers
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Follow-up Study of Substance Abuse Screening and Intervention in Multi Primary Care Centers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to improve the ability of primary medical staffs in screening and intervention for alcohol, benzodiazepines, and other illicit drug use.

detailed_description.textblock: In order to reduce the social and personal harm caused by drugs, it is urgent to strengthen the ability of the primary health institutions in screening and intervention the addictive substances use. Firstly, the investigators will invite 10 primary medical staffs and 10 experts in addition to revise the manual of Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Use Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST) and Brief Intervention (BI). Then, the investigators will recruit related medical staffs in five provinces to participate the training of ASSIST and BI. Secondly, the researcher will investigate the effects of BI technology in reducing the use of addictive substances, improve the addiction related knowledge of patients through randomized controlled study. Finally, the investigators will collect the research information, revise the manual, and promote the training.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in risk behaviors at 3,6,9 and 12 month
primary_outcome.description: Risk Behaviors will be measured by ASSIST questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge related to Substance Use measured by Knowledge related to Addiction questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Knowledge related to substance use will be measured by Knowledge related to Addiction questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation measured by Pre-treatment Readiness Scale
secondary_outcome.description: PRSS is a 5-point scale and the highest score at any stage represents the patient at this stage.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression measured by Self-Rating Depression Scale (SDS)
secondary_outcome.description: SDS contains 20 items and the standard total score is 53, 53-62: mild to mild depression; 63-72: moderate to severe;> 72: severe depression

secondary_outcome.measure: Anxiety measured by Self-Rating Anxiety Scale (SAS).
secondary_outcome.description: SDS contains 20 items. According to the Chinese norm results, the standard points of the cut-off value is 50 points, of which 50-59 is divided into mild anxiety, 60-69 is divided into moderate anxiety, 70 points for severe anxiety
the change of self-esteem will be measured by Self-esteem questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive and Negative Affect measured by Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS)
secondary_outcome.description: It contains 20 entries. A high positive emotional score indicates an individual's energy, concentration, and emotional well-being while a low score indicates indifference. Negative emotional high points that the individual subjective feeling puzzled, painful emotional state, while the score is low that calm.
